@{557058:4ded1ddf-947e-4154-bbd1-3dba24f1bdbd} do you know of any way to properly check for the correct time that `gz model ...` command can be called?

The checks I use include waiting for `gz topic -l | wc -l` to be greater than a certain number and checking for `pgrep gzserver`, but for some reason calling these too early causes an issue. Let me know if you can recreate this bug.

If instead I just change it to `sleep 10s` it works every time, but I feel that may be wrong for different situations \(slower or faster computers, model spawned too late for the competition, etc.\).
